description.p: applies the CCG Parser to sentences specified as annotations from the layer. Sentence words are specified by annotations in the layer. For each sentence, only words entirely included in the sentence will be considered; and should create these layers with the appropriate annotations. Additionally CCGParser takes advantage of word POS tag specified in the feature.

param-doc.name: sentenceRole
param-doc.p: Name of the role that denote the sentence to which belongs a dependency tuple.

param-doc.name: stanfordMarkedUpScript
param-doc.p: Path to the markedup script for Stanford tagset output. See Biomedical parsing for CCG.

param-doc.name: maxSuperCats
param-doc.p: Maximum number of supercats before the parse explodes (cited from CCG documentation).

param-doc.name: dependencyRelation
param-doc.p: Name of the relation containing dependencies.

param-doc.name: stanfordScript
param-doc.p: Post-processing script for Stanford tagset output. See Biomedical parsing for CCG.

param-doc.name: lpTransformation
param-doc.p: Either to translate into LP tag-set.

param-doc.name: parserModel
param-doc.p: Path to the parser model file.

param-doc.name: headRole
param-doc.p: Name of the role that denote the head word in the dependency tuple.

param-doc.name: labelFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature containing the dependency label.

param-doc.name: supertagFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature containing the supertag label.

param-doc.name: executable
param-doc.p: Path to the CCG Parser executable.

param-doc.name: dependentRole
param-doc.p: Name of the role that denote the dependent word in the dependency tuple.

param-doc.name: superModel
param-doc.p: Path to the CCG supertagger model file.
